name: the 'even better' granny rectangle
notes:
this pattern is also available for free on my blog and available as a free video tutorial. the downloadable pdf listed for sale is an ad-free printable version.  it is 16 pages long and has step-by-step progress photos (on pages 1-14) like the free version on my blog, it also includes just the written pattern (on pages 15-16) with no photos for those who do not want lots of photos to print out.

this pdf pattern is for the ‘even better’ granny rectangle which is a rectangle-shaped crochet motif that can be used in a variety of projects of your choosing. 

this pattern is graded as easy.  it has step-by-step progress photos.

crochet skills used: a simple pattern which uses uk treble crochet, double crochet and chains. knowledge of basic crochet stitches, techniques and terminology is assumed. knowledge of how a granny square is made, including working in rounds. working into chain spaces in the corners.

the pattern is written in uk terms used (us conversion chart provided).

materials & gauge: this pattern is suitable for any weight yarn and the corresponding crochet hook. gauge will depend on the yarn used. the sample used paintbox simply dk and a 4mm crochet hook.
